reviewText: i REALLY ENJOYED THIS MOVIE. I ALSO CAUGHT THIS MOVIE YEARS AGO ON HBO.  AND YOU KNOW, A FEW YEARS AFTER A VEEEERRY SIMILAR MOVIE CAME OUT.  "O BROTHER WHERE ART THOU"

The Grave is about two convicts played by Craig Sheffer (Fire In The Sky, Dracula II: Ascension) and Josh Charles (Coldblooded, SWAT) who bust out of the prison with the help from a security guard, that is John Diehl (Jurassic Park 3, Fail Safe(2000). The 2 escape to find fortunes in a grave but Charles is shot, so Sheffer takes him to Anthony Michael Hall (Weird Science, The Breakfast Club), Donal Louge (Blade, Reindeer Games) and Max Perlich (Drugstore Cowboy, Tv's Buffy The Vampire Slayer) for help. Things go off schedule as Charles dies, Sheffer is left for dead and the  rascals Perlich, Louge and Hall try to figure things out. Sheffer isn't dead, Perlich gets killed and the 3 (Hall, Sheffer and Louge) find the fortunes but things get even more twisted as they are locked in the secret room and then the fit really hits the shan from there. This is told by a voiceboxed mystery person and Keith David (Pitch Black, Requiem For A Dream) is along for the ride. Now this movie began dumb and ended dumb because it was so damn perdictable because I knew off the bat who the voiceboxed person was, it was the chick damnit! The chick was played by Gabrielle Anwar (The Guilty, Things To Do In Denver When Your Dead). Also starring Eric Roberts (National Security, The Specialist) and Giovanni Ribisi (Suburbia, The Mod Squad). Not much fun and they didn't eat any posums at all, why not!!!

I was lucky enough to catch this movie on HBO one late night a few years back... And was smart enough to pop in a vcr tape and dub it off... WHY WON'T THEY RELEASE THIS MOVIE ON DVD?! The cast and acting both are great... There are a seldom few movies I can watch over and over and everytime pay as close of attention as I did the first night I saw it... This is one of those movies... I can't understand why it has been such an unknown film... Donal Logue (Blade, and now the star of the hit tv series "Grounded For Life") stars in this movie, and it is his best performance i've ever seen... I LOVE HIS CHARACTER... It is my favorite in the entire movie... The pairing of "Travis, Boo, and Cletus" is classic... If you haven't seen this movie, I strongly suggest you do... My rating out of 5 is a 10...

I recently saw this late at night on TV and was surprised at how good it was (I wasn't expecting much)--and now I'm disappointed that it can't be found on DVD. It's basically a treasure-hunt movie, with the gold under (what else?) a grave in the swamps somewhere down South. The story may lack originality, but the dialogue and acting are fantastic. A cameo appearance by Eric Roberts in which he describes how his wife shoots him is absolutely hilarious. Even 80s-era teen star Anthony Michael Hall, playing an ex-con undertaker, finally plays a role well. Amazing. All in all, this is a very entertaining film.
Day be Not dat stupid, duhhh. Ya But, it had a surprise twist in the end?! Ouhhhh. More Hollyweird  Junk.!!
THIS WAS GREAT! Reminded me of a feature length "Tales from the Crypt."

An unexpectedly fun little movie, filled with twists, turns, chills and straight-up surprises.  The dialogue can be a little difficult for someone unaccustomed to the accents of the Deep South, but that only adds to the atmosphere of backwoods intrigue.  The darkly comedic storyline is engaging, supported by a very talented cast.  Thoroughly enjoyable!
Pretty funny !

A film definitely worth watching.  Especially if you like treasure hunting films.  The Grave is about a couple of guys in the joint, who get a hot tip on a hoard of buried treasure and break out of jail to find it.  Then the trouble begins. Anthony Michael Hall and Eric Roberts have good parts.  Additionally, the bluegrass sound track is pretty good too.  Highly recommend.

Pretty good movie fitting of its title "The Grave." Backwoods accents throughout and even though it's supposed to be of a thriller nature, there were lots lot of amusing dialogue throughout. The plot of the entire setting is Louisiana's swamps and cemeteries--Greed drives all characters even until the ending with the remaining and unfortunate clergyman. Great acting for such young actors, and worth the watch.

Everyone seems to have a different view of this movie. In some ways it is far-fetched, but not any more so than any other movie. This is some language that will offend some. The overall story isn't even all that eventful. What really makes the whole thing -- to me anyway, are the characters portrayed by a group of actors that most people had probably written off. There is something that rings true about the portrayal of the sub-culture of under-educated young men, something that rings true, even if it is just BS and bravado. I thoroughly enjoyed this, but I can see how it might be hit or miss for others.

The Grave is definitely worth watching. With all the hit and miss movies out there, it's nice to find a gem. This movie is like Cormac McCarthy meets the Cohen Brothers. It's very clever and actually funny in quite a few parts. The acting is very good and I was surprised by several of the performances in this film.

The narrator of the movie is telling the tale of woe of two prisoners who escaped a couple of years ago. Throughout a night of smoky jail cell talk, we learn of the prisoners who heard a rumor about a grave full of buried treasure. Naturally they got greedy. This starts the journey through the backwoods of Louisiana as the two escape the prison and go looking for the grave. The plot twists and turns towards the destination. Other characters, and I mean characters, join in. Though grisly and not for the overly sensitive, this is a pretty fun movie to watch.

I never realized that Anthony Michael Hall was that good of an actor. In this he plays Travis, an unfriendly undertaker who also takes an interest in the buried treasure. He is really good in this.

The Grave isn't deep or meaningful, it's just a fun little movie that offers up a decent plot and some very good performances.

This movie has a little of everything - humor, greed, chase, lust, etc. BUT, the very BEST part is that things aren't always what they seem. You have to watch all the way to the very end. It's not a movie that you can predict the ending which makes it fabulous!
Star studded cast, very hard to find! Watch this film!!!!!!!

Big fun to be had here, and partly because, while not exactly brilliant, this movie is hilarious, and most importantly, not monolithically formulaic as it hovers between thriller, swamp jail escape, Dixie Mayhem, and (sub-sub-urban) legend. Just grab the Cherries Garcia or your substance of choice, and get ready for a string of small town losers who can't doubletalk and double cross each other fast enough on the way to sniffing out buried treasure. If you jump on this ride, you track a mostly non-gory, but entirely believable string of madcap manslaughter, inelegant murders and nutty situations. A near-perfect weekend adult chill movie, with rompin' stompin through the swamp, all wrapped up in a story with a twisty jail-confession narrator revealing what really happened to a small Southern town's *urban legend* treasure from what turns out to be a shocking perspective.

So glad I happened on this one --which maybe Amazon just started streaming, not sure--  only because I watch everything ultra quirky character actor, Giovanni Ribisi's in, and wasn't disappointed (LOST IN TRANSLATION, SELMA, THE GIFT, FRIENDS). Ribisi,  a workfarm prisoner with a strange haircut and even stranger tale, sets it all off. More oddball performances turned in by Donal Logue of SONS OF ANARCHY and THE TAO OF STEVE, plus a short but unforgettable scene with legendary Eric Roberts, the seldom seen brother of you know who. Roberts is also a native Southern guy whose weird presence unfailingly takes everything up a notch. In that Harry Dean Stanton way, but with a triple twist.

Being from the South, I don't always find movie accents good enough, particularly in indie or indie-style films; but thankfully, Eric Roberts and Giovanni Ribisi levelled things up in that department here.

FINALLY! I have been hoping to see this movie again for YEARS. A tale full of twists and gruesomeness, not in the bloody gore kind of way. This movie is more of a suspense thriller with a dabble of horror story. All EXCELLENT actors. 90s cult classic that unfortunately slipped away in the wave of crappy movies that has become the U.S. culture norm. Give it a watch!

The release year for this movie may have been 2014, but it was filmed at least 20 years ago. I should've known by the lack of trailer that something was amiss. I'm more than a little irritated that I paid full price to rent a "new" movie only to find it was a sleeper from two decades ago. But if you want to see what was surely one of the first roles for most of the cast including Anwar give it a try.

A soundtract that you won't get out of your mind anytime soon ,DOYLE LAWSON and QUICKSILVER.Craig Sheffer who also starred in 80's chick flicks like BABYCAKES stars with real life one-time wife Gabrielle Anwar from BURN NOTICE the stylish,smart Miami cool ex spy show. THE GRAVE shows how greed, ignorance,and no honor amongst thieves doesn't mix. There are many current films that don't deserve to be on dvd,this does so what gives? I wish they could explain why they,the owners of the copyrighted material don't feel they can't make a ton of money off of this movie. THEY CAN!! ,put this on dvd, whoever owns the rights to this and watch what happens.

I agree with some others here that this needs to be on DVD. If Mr. Greed can do it for about $12 (instead of the typical $20-plus on many of thes re-releases) then I'll be glad to add it to my collection. This is a nicely entertaining film that sort of crosses "Things To Do In Denver" with "O Brother." Anwar is a real beauty whom I never tire of watching.

Like some of the other reviewers, I just can't figure out why this movie didn't gain more traction or end up on DVD.  This is one that truly stands out from the rest of the pack, in that it doesn't follow the standard format, and leaves you guessing and surprised right up until the last second.

An EXCELLENT movie. Why was it not more popular? Several people have already mentioned the plot & the cast & written great reviews, so I'll just say that the acting was amazing- some of the best I've seen from several of these popular actors. The basic story is a bit generic, but they did it so well & the feel of the movie is very unique & the relationship b/t the characters, the acting, etc, make it VERY realistic. It's an eery, scary sort of theme, but there is plenty of dark humor, as well. It's best to watch more than once to take it all in. Why is it not on DVD...?

I never saw these actors before and have no idea who they are or what they are doing now, but this is a piece of work you will either really enjoy or hate. The odd thing is that it reminds me of some of the people I knew in school. They weren't grave robbers, but some of them could have acted in this movie without much effort. The acting is first rate for a semi-gruesome flick.

How could Amazon possibly be wrong?  Oh, and that early scene where everyone is slashing at mud with their hoes?  And the guy with the broadcast sack is hurling ( really, really hurling) handfuls of seed(?) into the furrow, ground, mud?  Really?  Who writes this stuff?  Some NYC boy?
